name: CEEP - European Centre of Employers and Enterprises providing Public Services and Services of General Interest
goal:
CEEP gathers enterprises and organisations from across Europe, both public and private, at national, regional and local level,which are public employers or providers of services of general interest and is one of the three European Cross-Sectoral Social Partners.
CEEP has members in nearly all of the Members States and beyond the E.U territory. It represents the interest of its members to the European institutions. CEEP's priorities are:
to promote services of general interest, particularly regarding their crucial contributions to the European social and economic model;
to use the Social Dialogue as a means to modernise public services and to promote partnerships at all levels (local, regional, national and European) in view of the achievement of the EU2020 objectives; to reinforce sustainable development by influencing all European decisions affecting physical and social infrastructures (transport, energy, water supply, waste management, telecommunications, education, healthcare, social housing, social services).
to conduct research aimed at fulfilling its objective, either at its own initiative or at the request of other organisations, and to organise all seminars, colloquia and other forms of concerted action;
interests: Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
Social Dialogue.
Lobby activities.
Organisation of events related to the development and the progress of public services in Europe and applications to and management of EU funded projects.
